Welcome to Fast image’s documentation!¶

REST API repository cloud image¶

async src.repository.cloud_image.add_image(db: Session, url: str, public_id: str, user: User, description: str)¶

Add an image to the database.

This function adds an image entry to the database with the specified URL, public ID, user, and description.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • url (str) – URL of the image.

  • public_id (str) – Public ID of the image.

  • user (User) – The user who uploaded the image.

  • description (str) – Description of the image.

Returns:

The added image.

Return type:

Image | None

async src.repository.cloud_image.add_tag(db: Session, user: User, image_id: int, tag_name: str)¶

Add a tag to an image.

This function adds a tag to an image. If the tag does not exist, it is created before being added to the image.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – The user making the request.

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image.

  • tag_name (str) – Name of the tag to be added.

Returns:

Response containing a message and the added tag name.

Return type:

dict

async src.repository.cloud_image.black_white_image(body: ImageTransformModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

Apply a black and white effect to an image.

This function applies a black and white effect to an image in the database based on the provided ImageTransformModel. It creates a new image record with the effect applied and adds it to the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ImageTransformModel) – The data containing the image ID.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – The user making the request.

Returns:

Response containing the new image details.

Return type:

ImageAddResponse

async src.repository.cloud_image.change_size_image(body: ImageChangeSizeModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

Change the size of an image.

This function changes the size of an image in the database based on the provided ImageChangeSizeModel. It creates a new image record with the updated size and adds it to the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ImageChangeSizeModel) – The data containing the image ID and the new width.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – The user making the request.

Returns:

Response containing the new image details.

Return type:

ImageAddResponse

async src.repository.cloud_image.create_qr(body: ImageTransformModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

Generate and associate a QR code with an image.

This function generates a QR code for an image and associates it with the image in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ImageTransformModel) – Request body containing the image ID.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – The user making the request.

Returns:

Response containing the image ID and QR code URL.

Return type:

ImageQRResponse

async src.repository.cloud_image.delete_image(db: Session, image_id: int)¶

Delete an image from the database.

This function deletes an image entry from the database and also deletes the corresponding image from the cloud storage.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image to be deleted.

Returns:

The deleted image.

Return type:

Image | None

async src.repository.cloud_image.fade_edges_image(body: ImageTransformModel, db: Session, user: User)¶

Apply a fade edges effect to an image.

This function applies a fade edges effect to an image in the database based on the provided ImageTransformModel. It creates a new image record with the effect applied and adds it to the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ImageTransformModel) – The data containing the image ID.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – The user making the request.

Returns:

Response containing the new image details.

Return type:

ImageAddResponse

async src.repository.cloud_image.get_all_images(db: Session, current_user: User, keyword: str = None, tag: str = None, min_rating: float = None)¶

Retrieve all images from the database based on specified filters.

This function retrieves all images from the database based on the provided filters such as keyword, tag, and minimum rating.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user making the request.

  • keyword (str, optional) – Keyword to filter images by description.

  • tag (str, optional) – Tag to filter images.

  • min_rating (float, optional) – Minimum rating to filter images.

Returns:

Response containing the list of filtered images.

Return type:

ImagesByFilter

async src.repository.cloud_image.get_image_by_id(db: Session, image_id: int) → Image | None¶

Retrieve an image by its ID.

This function retrieves an image from the database based on its ID.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image to retrieve.

Returns:

The retrieved image or None if not found.

Return type:

Image | None

Parameters:

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image to be updated.

  • description (str) – New description for the image.

The updated image.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

REST API repository ratings¶

async src.repository.ratings.calculate_rating(image_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

Calculate the average rating for an image.

This function calculates the average rating for a given image ID and also retrieves the image URL. The average rating and image URL are returned in a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image for which the rating is calculated.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Dictionary containing the average rating and image URL.

Return type:

dict

async src.repository.ratings.create_rate(image_id: int, rate: int, db: Session, user: User) → Rating¶

Create a new rating for an image.

This function creates a new rating for a given image. It checks if the user is trying to rate their own post, has already voted, or if the image exists. If any of these conditions are met, it raises an HTTPException. Otherwise, it creates and returns the new rating.

Parameters:

  • image_id (int) – ID of the image to be rated.

  • rate (int) – Rating value (1 to 5 stars).

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Created Rating object.

Return type:

Rating

async src.repository.ratings.delete_rate(rate_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Rating]¶

Delete a rating.

This function deletes a rating with the given ID. Only the user who created the rating or an admin/moderator can delete a rating. It removes the rating from the database and commits the changes.

Parameters:

  • rate_id (int) – ID of the rating to be deleted.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Deleted Rating object.

Return type:

Type[Rating]

async src.repository.ratings.edit_rate(rate_id: int, new_rate: int, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Rating] | None¶

Edit the rating for a given image.

This function allows the user to edit their own rating or, if the user is an admin or moderator, edit any rating. It updates the rating value and commits the changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • rate_id (int) – ID of the rating to be edited.

  • new_rate (int) – New rating value (1 to 5 stars).

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Updated Rating object.

Return type:

Type[Rating] | None

async src.repository.ratings.show_my_ratings(db: Session, current_user) → list[Type[Rating]]¶

Retrieve all ratings given by the current user.

This function retrieves all ratings given by the current user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

List of ratings given by the current user.

Return type:

List[Type[Rating]]

async src.repository.ratings.user_rate_image(user_id: int, image_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Type[Rating] | None¶

Retrieve the rating given by a specific user to a specific image.

This function retrieves the rating given by a specific user to a specific image.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – User ID.

  • image_id (int) – Image ID.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • user (User) – Current user.

Returns:

Rating given by the specified user to the specified image.

Return type:

Type[Rating] | None

  • user (User) – Current user.

REST API routes auth¶

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate a user and generate access and refresh tokens.

This endpoint allows users to log in and receive access and refresh tokens for authentication.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Request form data containing the username and password.

  • db (Session, optional) – Database session.

Returns:

Access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

  • HTTPException 401 – If the email or password is invalid.

  • HTTPException 403 – If the user is banned.

async src.routes.auth.logout(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer)) → JSONResponse¶

Log out a user and invalidate the provided token.

This endpoint allows users to log out and invalidates the provided access token.

Parameters:

token (str) – Access token to be invalidated.

Returns:

JSON response indicating successful logout.

Return type:

JSONResponse

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token using a valid refresh token.

This endpoint allows users to obtain a new access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTP Authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

This endpoint allows creating a new user in the system.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Data of the new user.

  • db (Session, optional) – Database session.

Returns:

Information about the new user.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

  • HTTPException 409 – If a user with the specified email already exists.

  • HTTPException 201 – Upon successful user registration.

Parameters:

  • tag (str) – Tag to be added to the image.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Currently authenticated user.

Returns:

Response indicating the success of the operation.

AddTag

async src.routes.cloud_image.search_images(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), keyword: str = Query(None), tag: str = Query(None), min_rating: int = Query(None))¶

Search for images based on specified filters.

This endpoint allows users with the necessary roles to search for images based on various filters.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – Currently authenticated user.

  • keyword (str) – Keyword to search for in image descriptions.

  • tag (str) – Tag to filter images by.

  • min_rating (int) – Minimum rating for images.

Returns:

Images matching the specified filters.

Return type:

ImagesByFilter

async src.routes.comments.get_comment_by_image_id(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve comments for a specific image by its ID.

This endpoint allows a user to retrieve comments associated with a specific image by providing the image’s ID.

Parameters:

  • image_id (int) – The ID of the image for which to retrieve comments.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of comments for the specified image.

Return type:

List[CommentResponse]

db (Session) – Database session.

List[CommentResponse]

Create a rating for an image.

This endpoint allows a user to create a rating for a specific image.

Parameters:

  • image_id (int) – The ID of the image to rate.

Created rating.

RatingModel

Tag | None

async src.routes.tags.delete_tag(identifier: str, by_id: bool = False, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Tag | None¶

Delete a tag.

This endpoint deletes a tag either by ID or by name, based on the provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – The ID or name of the tag to delete.

  • by_id (bool) – Flag indicating whether the identifier is a tag ID. If False, it’s treated as a tag name.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted tag.

Return type:

TagResponse

async src.routes.users.ban_user(email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Ban a user.

This endpoint allows an administrator to ban a user by email.

  • email (str) – Email of the user to be banned.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user (admin).

Returns:

Banned user information.

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.change_user_role(body: ChangeRoleRequest, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

Change user role.

This endpoint allows an admin to change the role of a user.

Parameters:

  • body (ChangeRoleRequest) – Request body containing user email and new role.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

User information with updated role.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.get_user(email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶

Get user by email.

This endpoint retrieves a user by their email address. It requires admin or moderator privileges.

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

User information.
